title: Number of high street shoppers down 10pc in seven years
text:
The number of people visiting shops has been decimated in the past seven years, adding to the travails of retailers.

Trips to high streets, retail parks and shopping centres across the country were down by more than 10pc, the British Retail Consortium (BRC) and Springboard have said.

It lays bare the challenges retailers face on top of having to adapt to the shift to online as well as higher day-to-day running costs, such as increases in wages and business rates.

Footfall dropped by 1.7pc last month, the same as last year. Shopping centres were the worst hit, down by 3.2pc, followed by high streets at 1.8pc. Retail parks fared better, with footfall edging up slightly.
